The bandit Dick Johnson could have been a role tailor-made for PlÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¡cido Domingo, and although there area couple of
later recordings of him in the same part, this Fanciulla is perhaps the best of all his Puccini roles on
disc . . . As with all DG's 'Originals' series, it's beautifully presented.
Record Review / Patrick O'Connor, Gramophone (London) / 01. July 2004

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The lonely, hard-bitten atmosphere of gold-rush California pervades Zubin Mehta's flamboyant yet warm-hearted recording
of Puccini's "cowboy opera". Domingo is the roguish bandit to the core, and Carol Neblett seizes her big moment on
record.
Record Review / James Inverne, Gramophone (London) / 01. February 2008

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
